bibl.title: Letter from Laura Eugenia Hook Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, August 15, 1911

div1.p: Carter chats about relatives and friends.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Eugenia Hook Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, August 15, 1911
div1.p:
I hope this
will find you safe at your
Aunt Louise. Papa will take
you all of the news so it
is useless for me to write you
a long letter as I had intend-
ed to What induced you to call
on Helen I cannot imagine
Well yes I understand your
motive and I hope she appre-
ciated it; but I doubt it Mimme
has returned, she seems
delighted to be here again that
it is touching. She seems way
much improved in health.
The bride that I took so
much interest in has been
very ill and lost her baby.
I took her some grapes yesterday
and some Roses to day, she
can take no solid food
only buttermilk. She was
perfectly delighted with the
roses but she did not see
the grapes. My dear love to
Louise and the children.
I could not write to her
yesterday when I expected
to write to you I did not
go to church Sunday, so do
not know if the Semfales
were there. A heart full of love to you
my dear, and to all enquiring friends.
I have not yet written to Dixie
Tell her how I sympathized with
her and James in the great loss of
their darling boy. I cannot write now
I must close now for Papa has
finished his letter and will en-
close this in it all send love
to you all.
